image.alt: Frazier Orthodontics team in office, smiling with patient

paragraphs.text: Dr. James Frazier and the team at Frazier Orthodontics understand the power of a confident, beautiful smile. We’d be honored to help you transform your life with a smile that reflects your personality and lights up every room. Let’s create something amazing—together.

Advanced Technology. Exceptional Smiles. We proudly use the Damon® Smile and offer Damon® Clear™, SPARK™ Clear Aligners, and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> to provide effective, comfortable, and efficient treatment options tailored to your goals.

paragraphs.text: Dr. James Frazier brings a unique blend of expertise, dedication, and community spirit to his River Forest practice. He trained at the University of Pennsylvania Dental School and completed his orthodontic residency at the University of Illinois at Chicago. Dr. Frazier is committed to precision, personalized care, and giving back to the community.

image.alt: Dr. James Frazier, orthodontist at Frazier Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Explore our treatment options, from Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and Spark™ clear aligners to Damon® braces and advanced digital scanning with iTero®, all delivered with personalized care.

image.alt: Patient smiling while holding Invisalign aligners
Damon braces patient smiling
Spark Clear Aligners displayed in case
iTero digital scanner used for no-goop digital impressions

testimonials.author: Paul T.
testimonials.testimonial: “I had been conscious of the spaces between my teeth for years... I only had the braces on for 18 months. By this time, in my late 40s, that 18 months went by quickly. I’m pleased with the results and I wish I had gone ahead with the braces 10 years earlier … but better late than never.”

testimonials.author: Elissa B.
testimonials.testimonial: “Our family could not have asked for a better experience than what we had with Dr. Frazier and his staff. My teenaged son and daughter both agree that they had a great experience.”

testimonials.author: Lynn T.
testimonials.testimonial: “Two of our children received braces from Frazier Orthodontics. The results are wonderful; they both have beautiful new smiles... Dr. Frazier and his entire staff were always professional, caring, and very efficient.”

testimonials.author: Dana F.
testimonials.testimonial: “It was a wonderful experience being a patient at Frazier Orthodontics. The entire staff was nice, caring, and knowledgeable. Dr. Frazier was great in explaining in detail my case and the process I needed to complete to get my desired results.”

About.title: Transforming Smiles at Every Age—Because Everyone Deserves to Smile with Pride

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in the Lakeshore Orthodontics office lobby

paragraphs.text: We are dedicated to making sure that you receive the quality orthodontic care you deserve. We take a personalized, patient-first approach—combining genuine compassion with the latest orthodontic technology to create custom treatment plans tailored to your unique needs and goals.

Your comfort is our priority, and exceeding your expectations is our standard. From initial consultation through retention, we guide every patient with clear explanations, thoughtful scheduling, and a team that treats you like family.

image.alt: Dr. James Frazier's professional headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. James Frazier — Orthodontist, is passionate about helping patients of all ages achieve smiles that boost confidence and support long-term oral health. He and his team use a patient-first approach and modern orthodontic technologies to design treatment plans that fit each patient's lifestyle.

Whether braces or clear aligners are the best option, Dr. Frazier guides every step from the initial consultation through retention, focusing on comfort, clear communication, and predictable care. Schedule your complimentary consultation at https://www.frazierorthodontics.com/appointment-request.

image.alt: Dr. James Frazier and a patient smiling together

paragraphs.text: Dr. Frazier stays current with evidence-based orthodontic techniques and digital workflows, including Damon brackets and modern clear aligner systems. His treatment philosophy emphasizes efficient, comfortable care tailored to each patient's needs.

image.alt: Dr. James Frazier holding a small dog and smiling

paragraphs.text: When he’s not caring for patients, Dr. Frazier enjoys community involvement and spending time with patients and neighbors throughout River Forest and surrounding communities. He values building long-term relationships that make treatment easier and more rewarding for every family he treats.

image.alt: Dr. James Frazier and a young patient smiling

slides.alt: Doctor consulting with a patient in the office
Digital iTero scanner used for 3D imaging

paragraphs.text: Dr. Frazier and the Frazier Orthodontics team strive to create positive experiences for patients and families in the communities we serve. We are proud to treat patients from River Forest, Oak Park, Forest Park, Elmwood Park, Riverside, Melrose Park, and surrounding Chicago communities, and we work to make orthodontic care accessible and comfortable for patients of all ages.

image.alt: Graphic representing community support by Lakeshore Orthodontics
Family smiling after orthodontic treatment

seo.page_description: Learn how Frazier Orthodontics delivers personalized, modern orthodontic care for children, teens, and adults in River Forest and the greater Chicago area.

og_meta.title: About Us | Frazier Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Personalized, modern orthodontic care for River Forest, Oak Park, and surrounding communities. Schedule a complimentary consultation today.

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Lakeshore Orthodontics front desk

paragraphs.text: Begin with a complimentary consultation at Frazier Orthodontics where Dr. Frazier and the team perform a complete evaluation including diagnostic photos, a panoramic X‑ray, and a 3D iTero digital scan so you can see a clear view of your teeth and learn which treatment options may work best for you.

We will review your dental and medical history, complete a bite assessment, outline a personalized treatment plan and timeline, and go over financing and insurance options; same‑day starts are available for patients who are ready to begin.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We will help you build a payment plan that fits your budget, offering in‑office financing, a pay‑in‑full discount, and partnerships with third‑party lenders like CareCredit to make treatment accessible. Our treatment coordinator can walk you through options and explain any available discounts.

Frazier Orthodontics accepts many major insurers and will file claims on your behalf to simplify the process; we accept credit and debit cards and can assist with FSA, HSA, or HRA reimbursement questions. For specific coverage questions or CareCredit details, call 708-366-6595 or request an appointment online.

To streamline your first visit, please complete your medical and dental history in advance; downloadable PDF forms are available for children and adults, and you may also submit your information through our online appointment request and intake form before arriving.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

button.label: Child Medical/Dental History Form (PDF)

button.label: Adult Medical/Dental History Form (PDF)

image.alt: Family smiling after orthodontic treatment

seo.page_description: Begin your smile journey with a complimentary consultation at Frazier Orthodontics. Complete forms online or download PDFs and schedule your appointment today.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, consultation, patient forms, Frazier Orthodontics, Invisalign

og_meta.title: Get Started | Frazier Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Begin your smile journey with a complimentary consultation at Frazier Orthodontics. Complete forms online or download PDFs and schedule your appointment today.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Two‑phase orthodontic treatment combines early guidance of jaw growth with later tooth alignment to produce stable, long‑lasting results. Phase One focuses on creating room and guiding development so future treatment is simpler and gentler. After a monitoring period we begin Phase Two, which aligns every tooth into its final position, usually with full braces.

Phase One, typically around ages six to eight, uses appliances that guide jaw development, correct crossbites and create space for permanent teeth. Early action can reduce the need for extractions or more invasive procedures later.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: After Phase One we monitor eruption and growth, making selective decisions — such as baby‑tooth extractions when needed — to ensure the best timing for final alignment.

image.alt: Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Phase Two places full upper and lower braces or aligners to precisely position every tooth. Treatment finishes with retainers to preserve the results and a healthy, confident smile.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention
Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Orthodontic treatment is not just for teens. Adults pursue care for shifted or worn teeth, incomplete prior treatment, bite problems and aesthetic goals. Modern options such as self‑ligating braces, clear ceramic brackets and clear aligners make adult treatment efficient, discreet and tailored to busy lives.
We’ll review appliance choices, timing and expected results during a consultation so you can choose the option that best fits your goals and lifestyle.
Improved oral hygiene, corrected bite forces to reduce wear, and enhanced confidence are common reasons adults seek orthodontics. Discreet options help keep treatment low‑profile.

image.alt: Adult patient receiving orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: Many adult patients report minimal disruption to work and daily life. Appointments are planned for efficiency and comfort, and we tailor retention strategies to protect your investment.

image.alt: Smiling family enjoying time together
Adult patient receiving orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: We offer advanced passive self‑ligating braces such as the Damon systems. These use a slide mechanism instead of elastic ties to reduce friction, which can allow gentler forces, more efficient tooth movement and fewer adjustments in many cases.

The passive self‑ligating design reduces resistance so teeth can move with lighter forces. That often improves comfort and can help shorten treatment time while achieving precise finishing and bite correction.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces

paragraphs.text: Damon Clear offers a discreet, stain‑resistant option for patients who want the effectiveness of fixed appliances with improved aesthetics.

image.alt: Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner
Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners are a removable, nearly invisible option that can treat crowding, gaps, crossbites and many bite issues. Aligners are made from SmartTrack® material and are typically worn 20–22 hours per day for predictable tooth movement.

We use iTero digital scans to plan treatment and show you a virtual preview of expected results. Aligners make brushing and flossing simple and are a popular choice for adults and teens who want discretion.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Severe jaw discrepancies such as pronounced underbites, deep overbites or significant asymmetry sometimes require orthognathic surgery combined with orthodontics to restore function and facial balance. When surgery is indicated we coordinate closely with oral and maxillofacial surgeons to plan precise, staged care.

Early orthodontic intervention can reduce the chance that surgery will be necessary later, but in cases where surgery is the best path, thorough planning and teamwork lead to predictable, life‑changing results.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: Retainers preserve the results of orthodontic treatment. We offer custom removable and fixed retainers and provide guidance to help your new smile last a lifetime.
To reduce long‑term replacement costs and inconvenience, we offer a Retainer Protection Program. The plan covers repairs and replacements for a decade with a small copayment.

Program highlights: Full Comprehensive Treatment RPP cost $880 (option to split into four monthly payments of $220). Limited treatment (one arch) $440. Coverage includes removable retainers ($200/arch), repairs and replacement of fixed retainers, up to four sets per year, 10‑year term, $25 copay per replacement/repair. All purchases final.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: We use modern digital tools to improve precision, comfort and predictability throughout treatment. These technologies shorten appointments, improve planning and enhance patient communication.
Fast, radiation‑free iTero scans capture precise 3D images used for aligner design and treatment planning, eliminating messy impressions and improving accuracy.

image.alt: iTero digital scanner in use during orthodontic consultation

paragraphs.text: Remote monitoring platforms allow patients to submit short scans from home so the doctor can track progress between visits. This reduces in‑office appointments while keeping care on schedule.

image.alt: Remote scan kit for monitoring orthodontic progress

paragraphs.text: Devices such as VPro+ can help seat aligners and may accelerate aligner therapy when clinically appropriate, improving fit and efficiency.

image.alt: VPro device used to assist aligner seating

paragraphs.text: Self‑ligating systems such as Damon Ultima offer precise tooth control and lighter forces, which can improve comfort and reduce adjustment frequency for many patients.

image.alt: Ultima bracket and archwire system
Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology
Family smiling after orthodontic treatment

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about braces, aligners, emergencies, and getting started with Frazier Orthodontics.
Orthodontics, also called dentofacial orthopedics, is a dental specialty focused on diagnosing, preventing, and treating dental and facial irregularities to create healthy alignment and function.

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

paragraphs.text: An orthodontist is a dental specialist who completes dental school plus two to three years of additional residency training to learn how to move teeth and align jaws safely and effectively.

image.alt: Couple Enjoying Time Together

accordion.header: What’s the best age to visit the orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: People of any age can benefit from orthodontic care. The American Association of Orthodontists recommends a first check by about age seven so we can monitor development and plan early if needed. Adults are treated commonly as well.

image.alt: Collaborative Team Spirit Moment

accordion.header: How long will I wear braces?

paragraphs.text: Treatment time depends on your individual case. Many patients complete care in 6 to 30 months, with a typical range around 18 to 21 months. We’ll give you a personalized timeline at your first visit.

image.alt: Collaborative Team Spirit Moment

paragraphs.text: Braces shouldn’t cause severe pain, but you may feel some pressure or soreness when brackets are placed or after adjustments. Warm salt-water rinses and over-the-counter pain relievers usually help while you adapt.

image.alt: Smiling Man Working at Desk

accordion.header: How do I care for my teeth with braces or retainers?

paragraphs.text: Brush thoroughly after meals and floss daily. Use fluoride toothpaste, keep retainers clean, avoid sticky or hard foods, and continue routine dental checkups. We provide step-by-step brushing and flossing instructions at appointments.

image.alt: Mother and Daughter Smiling Together

accordion.header: What foods should I avoid or can I eat with braces?

paragraphs.text: Avoid chewy, crunchy, sticky, and very hard foods such as bagels, popcorn, caramel, nuts, and hard candy. Foods that are generally safe include soft dairy, pasta, cooked vegetables, soft breads, bananas, and soft desserts without nuts.

image.alt: Smiling Man Working at Desk

accordion.header: What should I do for orthodontic emergencies?

paragraphs.text: True emergencies are uncommon. For severe pain or appliance problems you can’t manage, call us. Many issues have temporary home remedies: salt-water rinses and soft foods for soreness; orthodontic wax for poking wires; save any loose bracket and bring it in for repair.

image.alt: Mother and Daughter Smiling Together

accordion.header: What treatment options do you offer?

paragraphs.text: Frazier Orthodontics offers a range of options including Damon Smile and Damon Clear, Spark Clear Aligners, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, and traditional braces. We also use digital tools such as iTero scanners for accurate, comfortable impressions.

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

accordion.header: How do I start — scheduling, forms, and what to bring?

paragraphs.text: Schedule a complimentary consultation using our appointment request page. Complete patient information before your visit and bring any recent dental records or X-rays. Patient form PDFs are available on the Patient Forms page before your first appointment.

image.alt: Couple Enjoying Time Together

accordion.header: What insurance, payment, and financing options are available?

paragraphs.text: We review treatment plans and payment options with each family. The practice offers in-office financing, pay-in-full discounts, third-party financing such as CareCredit, and assistance filing insurance claims. Call the office to discuss details for your plan.

image.alt: Smiling Man Working at Desk

accordion.header: What types of retainers do you offer and how do I care for them?

paragraphs.text: Wear retainers as instructed, remove them for eating, store them in their case, and clean them daily. We offer clear, Hawley, and fixed retainers and provide care instructions and a Retainer Protection Program to help protect your investment.

image.alt: Collaborative Team Spirit Moment
